snippet: Genteel towns in the Litchfield Hills of Connecticut are shocked by charges against Jasper Johns’s assistant.
abstract: Arrest of James Meyer, longtime assistant to artist Jasper Johns, on charges of stealing 22 works from Johns and selling them through unidentified New York gallery for $6.5 million rocks Kent, Conn, art scene, where Johns is fixture; scandal highlights often fraught relationship between established star and younger hopeful working on his behalf.

byline.original: By PETER APPLEBOME and GRAHAM BOWLEY
byline.contributor: Kristin Hussey and William K. Rashbaum contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Genteel towns in the Litchfield Hills of Connecticut are shocked by charges against Jasper Johns’s assistant.

headline.main: Theft Charges Reverberate in Connecticut Art World
